alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:51PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Boise, southwestern Valley, northeastern Gem and southeastern Adams Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 151 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Council Mountain to Banks. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cascade, Smiths Ferry, Crouch, Donnelly, Sage Hen Reservoir, Cascade Reservoir, Four Bit Summit, Indian Mountain, Council Mountain, Granite Peak, Big Eddy, Tamarack Ski Area and High Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
